clinical_study.brief_title: Properties of Glass Ionomer Cements Associated With Chlorhexidine or Doxycycline
clinical_study.official_title: Biological and Physicomechanical Properties of Glass Ionomer Cements Associated With Chlorhexidine or Doxycycline

collaborator.agency: Fundação de Amparo à Pesquisa do Estado de São Paulo

brief_summary.textblock: This study assessed the clinical performance of a resin-modified glass ionomer cement containing different concentrations of chlorhexidine digluconate and doxycycline hyclate.

detailed_description.textblock: This study aimed to evaluate the in vivo microbiologic action of the best concentration of chlorhexidine and doxycycline associated with the resin-modified glass ionomer cement applied on remaining dentine after indirect pulp treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Indirect Pulp Treatment using GIC associated with 1.25% CHX or 4.5% DOX.
primary_outcome.description: Within 3 months after the initial treatment, the teeth were submitted to clinical and radiographic examination to determine signs and symptoms of pulp vitality.

secondary_outcome.measure: Indirect Pulp Treatment using GIC associated with 1.25% CHX or 4.5% DOX.
secondary_outcome.description: Dentine samples were collected at baseline and after 3 months of the treatment for microbiological evaluation (colony-forming unit - CFU).

arm_group.description: Deciduous teeth were filled with GIC containing 1.25% chlorhexidine.
Deciduous teeth were filled with GIC containing 4.5% doxycycline.
Deciduous teeth were filled with GIC without chlorhexidine or doxycycline.

intervention.description: Carious dentine was sampled from the mesial portion of the cavity floor and the pulpal wall was entirely covered with one of the randomly selected materials: GIC containing 4.5% DOX; GIC containing 1.25% CHX or GIC as a control group. The antimicrobial concentrations were chosen based in the previous in vitro results obtained in this study. The cavities were then temporarily restored using a conventional GIC. Within 3 months after the initial treatment,the materials were carefully and completely removed, a new dentine sample was collected, and the teeth were then restored with a light-cured composite resin using a bonding system, after a new placement of the initial liner material.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- an active deep carious lesion at the internal half of the dentine thickness of a primary molar that had not been previously restored and that involved the occlusal or occlusoproximal surface;
- the absence of signs of irreversible damage to the pulp
- the absence of radiolucencies at the interradicular or periapical region or thickening of the periodontal spaces, absence of internal and external root resorption, absence of calcification of the pulp tissue
- children presenting no systemic disease or those not using medications.
Exclusion Criteria:
- presence of signs of irreversible damage to the pulp
- children presenting systemic disease or those using medications.
